moves.1. c4:
This was definitely a game of two halves as they say. It all started reasonably well then after around 20 moves everything fell apart. I think I learnt a lot from this game but would still be interested to see comments and thoughts.

Analysis is also available at http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=18461988&rnd=0.7610093399416655
moves.1... Nf6: English, 1...Nf6 (Anglo-Indian defense) (A15), I'm not sure why but this isn't a response I see often to my favoured c4 opening
moves.2. Nc3 g6 3. Nf3 Bg7 4. e4 d6 5. d4 O-O: This is quite a common choice but I think I prefer e5 here for black
moves.7. O-O Na6: While its still well within the Gameknot opening database I don't really understand this move. The computer calls it an innacuracy
moves.8. a3: This was to prevent a knight incursion on b4 but the computer calls it a mistake preferring e5
moves.8... cxd4 9. Nxd4 Nc5 10. f3 a5 11. b3: This move seems very passive to me I'm still not entirely sure why i made it.
moves.11... Ra6: This was a bit unexpected I'm not sure where the rook is headed
moves.12. Be3 Bd7 13. b4: Now my a1 rook is defended I can safely do this but I don't think its best as it allows black to exchange off his a rook which looks awkward to me
moves.13... axb4 14. axb4 Rxa1 15. Qxa1 Ne6 16: Trying to push the black queen out of harms way
moves.17... Qb8 18. Qb1: This is another move that I think especially with the benefit of hindsight is too passive
moves.18... Rc8 19. Qd3 b6 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Qx:
I thought long and hard about this and decided to take with the queen so as not disrupt my pawn structure too much, in particular I didn't want to open the c rank for black. As it turns out this was the start of my demise.

Analysis calls this an inaccuracy
moves.21... Be5 22. Bh6: This didn't seem unreasonable at the time, the bishop is pretty safe there and keeps the black king hemmed in, I just need to work out how to get at it however analysis calls this a mistake preferring g3
moves.22... Bxb5 23. Qxb5:
For some reason I completely missed the threatened fork here. I took with the queen to avoid doubled pawns and to keep the c rank closed.

Analysis calls this a mistake and gives black a large advantage from this point.
moves.23... Nd4 24. Qd7: I saw this as an attempt to cut my losses but at this point I started to lose my way, the computer prefers Rxd4, from now on I fall into my opponents hands completely.

gameName: How to lose at chess pt 7
